intro: Gentiana doluchanovii, commonly known as the Doluchanov's gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which typically bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Gentiana doluchanovii is part of the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue or purple flowers. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in the ecological diversity of its mountainous habitat.
